alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 6:52PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Brantley, east central Ware and northern Charlton Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Race Pond, or 9 miles north of Stephen Foster State Park, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, pea size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Race Pond and Winokur. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Western Charlton
